pr_title: OWLS-80451 - Enhance logHome to override HTTP access log location

timeline.message: fix minor indentation bug in web-server sit config
add httpAccessLogInLogHome to various create domain samples
add httpAccessLogInLogHome to documentation for create domain samples

timeline.bodyText: Change each file to 'files', or add an 'an' before each HTTP.  Dealers choice.
timeline.author: tbarnes-us
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -140,14 +140,15 @@ The following parameters can be provided in the inputs file.
 | `domainUID` | Unique ID that will be used to identify this particular domain. Used as the name of the generated WebLogic domain as well as the name of the Kubernetes domain resource. This ID must be unique across all domains in a Kubernetes cluster. This ID cannot contain any character that is not valid in a Kubernetes service name. | `domain1` |
 | `exposeAdminNodePort` | Boolean indicating if the Administration Server is exposed outside of the Kubernetes cluster. | `false` |
 | `exposeAdminT3Channel` | Boolean indicating if the T3 administrative channel is exposed outside the Kubernetes cluster. | `false` |
+| `httpAccessLogInLogHome` | Boolean indicating if server HTTP access log file should be written to the same directory as `logHome` if `logHomeOnPV` is true. Otherwise, server HTTP access log file will be written to directory specified in WebLogic domain home configuration. | `true` |

replies.bodyText: For example:  Boolean indicating if server HTTP access log files should be written to the same directory aslogHomeiflogHomeOnPVis true. Otherwise, server HTTP access log files will be written to directory specified in WebLogic domain home configuration.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText:
Actually, the preferred choice is to use plurals, so log file -> log files.
written to directory -> written to the directory
specified in WebLogic domain home -> specified in the WebLogic domain home
replies.author: rosemarymarano

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -98,13 +98,14 @@ The following parameters can be provided in the inputs file.
 | `domainType` | Type of the domain. Mandatory input for SOA Suite domains. You must provide one of the supported domain type values: `soa` (deploys a SOA domain),`osb` (deploys an OSB (Oracle Service Bus) domain),`soaess` (deploys a SOA domain with Enterprise Scheduler (ESS)),`soaosb` (deploys a domain with SOA and OSB), and `soaessosb` (deploys a domain with SOA, OSB, and ESS). | `soa`
 | `exposeAdminNodePort` | Boolean indicating if the Administration Server is exposed outside of the Kubernetes cluster. | `false` |
 | `exposeAdminT3Channel` | Boolean indicating if the T3 administrative channel is exposed outside the Kubernetes cluster. | `false` |
+| `httpAccessLogInLogHome` | Boolean indicating if server HTTP access log file should be written to the same directory as `logHome`. Otherwise, server HTTP access log file will be written to directory specified in WebLogic domain home configuration. | `true` |

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -25,11 +25,12 @@ DomainSpec is a description of a domain.
 | `domainHomeInImage` | Boolean | True if this domain's home is defined in the Docker image for the domain. Defaults to true. |
 | `domainUID` | string | Domain unique identifier. Must be unique across the Kubernetes cluster. Not required. Defaults to the value of metadata.name. |
 | `experimental` | [Experimental](#experimental) | Experimental feature configurations. |
+| `httpAccessLogInLogHome` | Boolean | If true (the default), the server HTTP access log file will be written to the same directory specified in logHome. Otherwise, server HTTP access log file will be written to the directory configured in the WebLogic domain home configuration. |

replies.bodyText: should it be "the server's HTTP access log"
replies.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: @rosemarymarano should it be "...,then server HTTP access log files..." or "...,then the server's HTTP access log files..."?
replies.author: alai8

replies.bodyText: Previous edits have instructed you to use the plural, for example, server HTTP access log files will be written, etc.. If the meaning of the sentence refers to one or more log files, then use the plural. If it refers to only one file, then use the singular, for example, the server HTTP access log file will be written.
replies.author: rosemarymarano

replies.bodyText: LGTM.  Mark, feel free to comment more or resolve.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: I am good either way - I think, technically it can be multiple files right, because it ages them off, but I think it is close enough.
replies.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: Resolving.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

timeline.bodyText: the HTTP --> HTTP
timeline.author: tbarnes-us
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -79,12 +79,19 @@ includeServerOutInPodLog: true
 # The default is false.
 logHomeOnPV: false
 
-# The in-pod location for domain log, server logs, server out, and node manager log files
-# If not specified, the value is derived from the domainUID as /shared/logs/<domainUID>
+# The in-pod location for domain log, server logs, server out, node manager log, and
+# HTTP access log files. If not specified, the value is derived from the domainUID as
+# /shared/logs/<domainUID>.
 # This parameter is required if 'logHomeOnPV' is true.
 # Otherwise, it is ignored.
 logHome: /shared/logs/domain1
 
+# Set this value to 'false' to have the HTTP access log files written to the directory 
+# configured in the WebLogic domain home.
+# The default is 'true', which means the HTTP access log files will be written to
+# the logHome directory when logHomeOnPV is enabled.

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -449,6 +456,24 @@ public DomainSpec withIncludeServerOutInPodLog(boolean includeServerOutInPodLog)
     return this;
   }
 
+  /**
+   * Whether to write the server HTTP access log file to the directory specified in
+   * {@link #logHome} if {@link #logHomeEnabled} is true.
+   *
+   * @return true if the server HTTP access log file should be included in the directory
+   *     specified in {@link #logHome}, false if server HTTP access log file should be written
+   *     to the directory as configured in WebLogic domain home configuration
+   */

timeline.bodyText:
1 Does this work if web-server stanza exists already in the original config?
2 Or if web-server and web-server-log stanza exists already in the original config?
3 Or if both of the above exist and the file name is set to something else?
In similar situations for other mbean settings, we needed to special case overrides to use a different syntax to handle 1 and 2.  Not sure about 3 off the top my head.   For example, see the override code for logHome ...
timeline.author: tbarnes-us
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -980,6 +988,26 @@ def customizeDefaultFileStore(self, bean):
     self.undent()
     self.writeln("</d:default-file-store>")
 
+  def customizeAccessLog(self, name):
+    # do not customize if LOG_HOME is not set
+    logs_dir = self.env.getDomainLogHome()
+    if logs_dir is None or len(logs_dir) == 0:
+      return
+
+    # customize only if ACCESS_LOG_IN_LOG_HOME is 'true'
+    if self.env.isAccessLogInLogHome():
+      self.writeln("<d:web-server>")
+      self.indent()
+      self.writeln("<d:web-server-log>")
+      self.indent()
+      # combine-mode "replace" works regardless of whether web-server and web-server-log is present or not
+      self.writeln("<d:file-name f:combine-mode=\"replace\">"
+                   + logs_dir + "/" + name + "_access.log</d:file-name>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server-log>")
+      self.undent()
+      self.writeln("</d:web-server>")
+

replies.bodyText: yes to all 3 (surprisingly)
replies.author: alai8

replies.bodyText: The problem is that we need to work-around the fact that 'no name' mbeans aren't handled intuitively by situational config.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: Huh. Maybe something was fixed. Did you test on 12.2.1.3?  I assume we're still supporting that.
replies.author: tbarnes-us

replies.bodyText: Tested on both 12.2.1.3 and 12.2.1.4.
replies.author: alai8

replies.bodyText: Cool.  Thanks.  Sorry for the distraction, but overrides have been incredibly finicky in the past...
replies.author: tbarnes-us
